наяривал всю ночь на Элизабет.
10/10

É impossível jogar BioSchock Infinite sem se apaixonar pela Elizabeth. Eu nunca vi um npc com tanta "autonomia" do personagem protagonista como ela. Ela sorri, fica séria, apreensiva, arredia, indiferente, localiza dinheiro e gazuas escondidas, entre outras formas, além disso, ela constantemente te salva no meio de um combate jogando medkits, sais ou lhe arremessando munição.

A história em momento algum é linear e previsível, te faz ter constantes surpresas pelo enredo muito bem trabalhado, envolvendo racismo, fanatismo religioso, ideais separatistas e busca pelo poder absoluto.

Quanto aos gráficos, são lindos de doer, tem horas que realmente dá vontade de ficar parado apenas contemplando o ambiente. Vale cada centavo gasto, especialmente em uma sale!

Super-mega recomendado. Exceto se você for preguiçoso pra ler ou não tiver a mente aberta.

В эту серию никогда не играл. Познакомился с ней, только с Infinity.
Сказать хорошо об этой игре - ничего не сказать.
Сюжет проходится на ура. За полное прохождение игры 10 и более часов, успеваешь вжиться в эту маленькую историю, с глубоким концом. Теперь смотря на звезды, задумываешься. 
Есть система снаряжений, система способностей, добыча, секреты. 
Времяпровождение в этой игре было и будет очень приятным. Советую.

pros: interesting story and memerable charcaters
- the most beatiful city and enviroment ive seen to date
-skyhooks bring a sense of open world and fast pace combat
-high emotions
-elizabeth is the most helpful and fleshed out character and companion in a game so far. Garrus from mass effect and the other games a cool but their traits are only really shown through narrative. with elizabeth she has interesing things to say and does minor things that make her organic such as cough in smoke or around smokers and not go into the mens room with you or run ahead so it seems shes not following you and getting in the way( "skyrim"cough). She also finds salts, health and ammo exactly when you need it.
-Amazing voice acting
-unqiue graphics
-tons of underestimated vigors
-MORE BIOSHOCK
-gears add more varitey to combat with buffs like 75% chance to set enemies on fire with melee

Cons
-salts.Unlike in bioshock 1 and 2 you had stacks of eve hypo's which you could use in seconds and have up to 9 at once while not breaking the flow of combat. In infinte you cannot have stacks and your vigors( espically in the beginning) consume SO much salt. example. the second you run out you are restricted to your guns and have to often run from fights just to look around or wait for elizabeth to find some.This restricts you and ruines alot of potenial combat had.
-guns are generic and uninteresing
-no more visable upgrades on your guns like in bioshock 1 and 2
-SO much lore is missing
-enemys are bullet sponges near the end of the game
-Irrational wanted to make columbia feel alive. but you cant talk to anyone unless they talk to you at scripted parts of the game.bad move
-the "steal" mechanic is bad  as in when you first see the red letters in say a box in a bar in a back room with no one looking you think you can take it safely. the second you open it people start screaming and others attack you. pointless
-WHERE ARE THE DAMN GEAR BOOTS
-restricions. example: a nun in a airship will use a moltov to kill herself and destroy the airship your in. you know this. you open fire at her and guess what? divine intervention or some shit because the bullets go through her. The devoplers hold your hand at alot of parts in the game and the worst is you can tell.
-you can only have 2 guns which really restricts combat variety unlie in 1 and 2 where you had 8 at once
-combat more fps and not as fexiable as bioshock 1
-guns lack kick

Verdict 8/10
Its a great game and i do recommend it and playing on hard as its a tough but staisfying mode
however you do need to pay a close attention to the dialouge as the story off the skyhooks.
people need to look closer at the game and it doesnt deserve the 10/10 its been getting but does deserve every damn award it got at E3 as its a amazing game. you dont need to play the first 2 bioshock games to understand this one. however so much unseen potenial.

This is probably the most over rated game ever. As a shooter BioShock Infinite is OK, but as an RPG story it fails.

I really like action RPG's. But the shooting mechanics of Infinite are only OK. They are certainly nothing special in battles without the skylines, which is to say, most battles. The vigors are underpowered to the point that I soon stopped using them at all in most battles. "Possession for Less" was the only upgrade I really found to be worth the high cost.

While the technique used to tell the narrative is quite seemless within the action and applaudable, the actual story of Infinite, and how it is reveals itself, is diappointing. Ken Levine has a great imagination but an inventive plot doesn't excuse weak characters. 

I'm left scratching my head when reading reviews by people who think Booker and Elizabeth are such great characters. Booker especially is the stereotypical anti-hero; nothing special. Elizabeth is under-developed, her journey from someone horrified of murder to murderer seems too easy. 

If the game somehow examined the kernals of identity in a closer way there may be some effective drama. But unfortunately the reveals of the plot are only an excercise in reveals. What's worse is that multiple universe theory seems to be the sci-fi writer's get-out-of-jail free card.

Mulitple universe can be used to explain anything. It is pure laziness disguised as ingenuity. You think that your pet isn't an intergalactic overlord hell bent on ruling earth? Well, guess what... in some universe she is!

It makes the whole thing feel cheap. 

Why do we care about this Booker? Because he isn't Comstock? What about the Booker who is neither Comstock nor the one who had a daughter? 

Why care about this Elizabeth? There are infinite Elizabeths who are kinder, or smarter, or who don't need help. 

There are plenty of other stories that deserve more attention. Unless you can grab this game at $15 or less, don't bother.

On the Bioshock scale, this one was my least favourite. Great new play/fight elements and graphics are amazing, but I just felt like it was a lot easier. Story was still very very interesting although super confusing. I had to read another review to understand what I had witnessed. And I absolutely loved [spoiler]that the DLC tied it together with Bioshock 1.[/spoiler]

Let me just start by saying, There is absolutly not one thing that I don't like about this game. This is nearly a masterpiece! The gameplay, The sound quality, The storyline and most of all the Graphics are downright amazing! I am currently trying to model and render an environment similar to Bioshock in my own 3D modeling program, and it is no where close to easy. But Irrational Games must have found a way to make it easy, because the graphics in this game are nearly real. Buy this game and definitly get the Burial at Sea DLC's. Those are just as good!

[h1]Вот ради какой игры хочется стереть себе память[/h1]

Подобные игры ни в каких комментариях не нуждаются. Это идеальная смесь шутера, RPG и стимпанка с инновационными на момент ее выхода элементами геймплея, которая даже спустя столько лет может оставить вопросы, породить теории и заставить перепроходить это произведение искусства много-много раз. Здесь нет никаких кат-сцен, тупых диалогов, ненужных персонажей, дополнительных костюмов для Элизабет и пр. Зато есть сюжет, который до сих пор остается одним из самых интересных и эмоциональных, музыка, которая подчеркивают атмосферу игры, и за которую дали множество наград, необычная графика, лор, и еще куча других интересных мелочей. Играть обязательно. И игру, и DLC можно брать и без скидки. 

10/10
I've played bits of Bioshock and Bioshock 2  but I love Bioshock Infinite, I love the atmosphere of the game and the controls are easy / easy to learn.

Мне , как поклоннику предыдущих частей игры.. Эта совершенно не то , что я хотел бы ожидать. Да , вы оставили прежнюю боёвку , оставили эдакую "прокачку" , хоть и изменили ее до непонятно чего... Совершенно непонятный сюжет , полностью убранная атмосфера страха и напряженности , постоянное одиночество и то , что только сила воли заставляла вас идти в самую Ж.. для того , что-бы выжить. А тут... А тут... НИЧЕГО ! Все это просто испарилось. Но это уже мои предирки , давайте разберем игру так , как она есть и найдет то , что имеем. Часов на стиме мало , но была пройденна полностью премерно за месяц до этого в немного нелегальном варианте , скидки заставила меня купить трипл пак байшок. 
ну чтож , начнем. 
Плюсы. 
+Все так не плохой сюжет , хоть и непонятный и очень странная концовка.
+Не плохая боевка.
+Все еще доставляющая система эдакой "магии".
+Как всегда отличная графика по низким сист.требованиям.
Минусы
-Обднозначно полностью переделанная игра в плане атмосферы
-То , что разработчики начали прибегать к религии в игре - говорит о недостатке идей у разработчиков.
-Ближе к концу волны врагов становятся слишком долгие и напряжные , хочется засыпать под них.
-Вместе с хорорной составляющей , была убрана возможность собирать адам , как , допустим , во 2ой части.
-Первые минут 20-40 вы можете вообще не париться об игре , а тупо бегать по городу или пляжу.
-Воистину маленькое кол-во врагов. Вместо этого вы сможете лицезреть усиление обычных рядовых войнов на протяжении всей игры
-Слишком сильно порезали хардкорность игры , сама по себе идея девочки , которая даже потроны тебе доставляет..
Ну , думаю я описал все , что хотел. 
Игру купить стоит , но если вы не были "влюблены" в прошлые части - играть не советую. Это все только мое мнение , надеюсь отзыв вам помог.
Спасибо за внимание.

I'm not a fan of Bioshock, but this one was actually pretty good. I've played a fair bit of Bioshock 1 on the PlayStation 3, but always got bored of it. It was an incredibly dull game. I'm wondering whether that's just part of the console experience after playing Bioshock Infinite on the PC. 

It's not a challenging game. It stilll has the repetative elements of Bioshock 1, but just less off them. The levels are well designed for combat, with interesting use of interactive fixtures through tears and rails. The enemy AI is dull, and you won't find them circling around you or making good use of cover. They seem to move along set paths, repeatedly, as in A>B>A>B and will stay in the same spots. So if you fall back for cover or to lure them into a trap, they won't follow. 
 In contrast to the dull grunts who make up most of your cannon fodder, slightly larger enemies like fireman and handymen deliver a very large amount of damage while soaking up bullets. They're also very mobile, have long range weapons that can pin you down, and will generally be the biggest challanges you'll face.

 The story suffers quite a bit. Like in Bioshock 1, when you first start the whole scenario of why you're there just doesn't make sense. I suppose this is to prompt you to explore and enjoy discovering parts of the backstory. Things become more apparant the further you go, but this makes me start out the game with little motivation. I found the ending boring and pointless. I was very disappointed. 

 Overall, it's a fun, quick game to play when you just want to loose a few bullets to let off steam and relax. It's completely undemanding on normal difficulty, and something you can zone out while playing.

재미있는데 너무 스토리가 심도깊고 이해하기 어려웠다.

한 두세번해도 아깝지 않은게임인듯
ИГРА  КЛАСС  СОВЕТУЮ

POSITIVES
Solid FPS gameplay. Nothing special, but the special powers are pretty fun and useful.
Amazing story and very thought provoking.
Great graphics. Same fidelity as Battlefield 3, but less demanding.
No significant bugs.

NEGATIVES
Too many special powers. Some ended up not being used at all. Although some may see this as a positive.
Burial at Sea DLC is confusing unless you have played the previous Bioshock games. There are also some graphical optimisation issues in the DLC, where the framerate dips significantly at times.
AI has a few minor bug issues.

VERDICT
Good FPS and great story, however be aware that the Burial at Sea DLC will have more value if you've played the previous Bioshock games.
9/10
It comes with no difficulty that I say this is goes down as one of the greatest stories ever told. It is art, a masterpeice, a legendary part of gaming history.

Este juego logró convertirse en una de las experiencias más sobrecogedoras de todos los tiempos, y no es para menos, ya que una historia como la que ofrece Bioshock Infinite no logra salirse de nuestra mente por más que queramos sacarla. Es un título que derrocha calidad desde donde se le mire, conservando su excelente estilo artístico y manteniendo la jugabilidad con concepto que siempre ha estado presente desde su primera entrega. Los personajes ahora toman un papel mucho más trascendental en la trama principal y se crea un ambiente propicio para hacernos sentir afecto por los mismos, preocuparnos por sus condiciones y decidir cuidadosamente cada cosa que queremos que hagan durante nuestra partida, todo controlado por un guion magistral, que en alguna que otra ocasión se pierde entre tanta ambición, pero que al fin y al cabo logra dejar huella y convertirse en lo que en un principio se propuso a convertirse. Es en éste título en donde vemos reflejado que para un artista, es muy difícil dejar a un lado todas las ideas que se le vienen a la mente, porque todas esas ideas forman parte de un todo. El artista debe comprender que hay que prescindir de muchas características para lograr una obra maestra, y es por eso que muchos de los íconos de Infinite aparecen solo cuando se necesitan, actúan cuando deben hacerlo y ofrecen su aporte a la trama en las cantidades necesarias. Es una obra maestra, y como toda obra maestra, tiene sus imperfecciones, y por eso mismo es que es un FPS de primera calidad. Si antes se pensaba que Bioshock tenía potencial, ahora sí que es algo que se puede afirmar con total seguridad; al fin y al cabo, hay muchas puertas, todas conducen al mismo sitio, pero de manera diferente. El DLC Clash in the Clouds se puede tomar como un entretenimiento pasajero mientras se pone a la venta el contenido descargable principal. Es una arena de batalla en donde nos enfrentaremos a hordas de enemigos para ganar puntos y dinero que podremos utilizar para desbloquear objetos coleccionables y demás.
The mind blowing game and very brain hurting too!!! play and enjoy!!!!!

First want to clear this up: this isn't a bad game. Its just not good enough to recommend. You won't "waste" your money by buying this game. 

Now that's done, so onto the actually review.

Mistakes confusing story for story depth. Its like the writers decided on plot twists, but either the devs or the writers themselves didn't care how it led to them as long as you eventually arrived there. When I do want to know more about the world, it interrupts me every time. Its like being on a guided museum tour where the guide occasionally forcibly yanks you away from something you were looking at to play one of those silly target shooting carnival games. It visually promises an interesting rich world that it tries its best to keep you from getting engaged in.

As a shooter it fails. Its just killing things until the spawn counter goes down and every 5th or so thing is a slightly bigger thing. The shoot-out sequences are long and boring. While the ability to jump onto rails freshens it up a little, it does not save it from the bland enemies. Fighting enemies feels more like time padding. Its like grinding levels in a JRPG that has an interesting battle system, but gives you the same 3 enemies so you'll never have to use any of those elements.

The game tries so hard to hold onto what previous Bioshocks offered, it fails at delivering what could have been a fantastic new world to explore. I would like them to try making this again, but a little more focued this time. I understand a lot went wrong during the development. However, this is a review of the end product. 

In the end, it is worth a play-through. Its just not good enough that I'd recommend it. Its an entertaining enough experience, but an utterly forgettable one.

Si tratta di un lavoro curato nei minimi dettagli, in maniera maniacale, senza lasciare nulla incompleto o con qualche difetto.

Man mano che si procede nel il gioco non ci si può che stupire del lavoro colossale che sta dietro ogni angolo di Columbia, dalla cura con cui sono progettate le insegne pubblicitarie, lo stile delle scatole, dei comodini, delle architetture, dei bagni o di qualsiasi altro elemento presente nel gioco, nulla è stato fatto senza ispirarsi ai primi del '900.

Il gameplay è progettato per divertirsi senza doversi impegnare troppo, probabilmente per lasciare più spazio alle scene cinematografiche di cui tutto l'andamento della gioco è ricco. Ci sono molti modi per affrontare gli avversari, è semplice entrare nella meccanica e tutto è progettato per essere accessibile e profondo.

In generale, considerando il lavoro svolto, quelle poche pecche che si presentano sono davvero di poco conto rispetto a tutto il resto.

Il linguaggio del gioco è ben curato e il ritmo ricorda Uncharted, nel contenuto ci trovo qualche collegamento con i film di Christoper Nolan, come poi anche i precedenti episodi. Un problema che emerge inesorabile man mano che si procede nel gioco è la meccaniche che diventa sempre più sparatorie ed esplosioni e meno racconto, sempre più cervellotico e intrecciato, fino al concludersi con dei momenti in stile Odissea nello Spazio. Secondo me il finale è esagerato e poco chiaro.

PRO
- Gameplay semplice e intuitivo
- Livelli mostruosamente curati
- Inizio fantastico e immersivo
- Traduzioni curatissime
- Musiche ben bilanciate e di grande atmosfera

CONS
- I Vigors non sono tanto meglio delle armi
- Più si arriva in fondo e più la storia cede il passo ad esplosioni, spari e ancora esplosioni
- Storia forzatamente complicata, si finisce per perdere un po il focus del racconto per momenti di chaos psicologico

When looking at a game, I look at 2 key elements: The gameplay and the story.  The gameplay for Bioshock Infinite is a 7.5/10.  While I love the vigors and the elements that brings to the fighting arena, the weaponry and gameplay for fighting sequences is lacking. First, you're only able to hold 2 weapons at a time, and once you start upgrading them, you don't want to get rid of them for a new, un-upgraded weapon. I found myself holding onto the shotgun and machine gun the entire game simply because I had upgraded the power, ammunition amount, and range for both before getting to guns with more appeal. Like most games, if you shoot an enemy in the foot enough times, they will die, but headshots do critical damage which is nice for sniping a few before being thrown into the heat of it. The vigors definitely help the gameplay. Ability to set up traps before a battle brings a methodical element to it instead of just going ape**** on tons of enemies.  All that being said; the story makes the game. I have never played a game with such a compelling story.  Being a fan of Bioshock, I was skeptic about leaving the familiar atmosphere of Rapture.  But 2K gaming and irrational proved to make Columbia just as magical a place.  The atmosphere which was hauntingly and eerily beautiful, played to the plot wonderfully. A captivating story that is well worth the investment. With Bioshock sales, 2K sales, Season Sales, and Weekend Sales, the Bioshock series is on sale a lot. I would suggest purchasing the Infinite + Season Pass Bundle.  Burial at Sea was a beautiful DLC add-on that brought the characters from Columbia to Rapture in its heyday.  with a 7.5/10 for gameplay, a 10/10 for story, and a bonus +1 point for the atmosphere of Columbia, I give Bioshock Infinite a 18.5/20, a Must buy ranking

One of my favorite games. The story in the game was fantastic and the Burial at Sea DLC adds a lot more lore to the game. I had played it on XBOX 360 and had to own it on PC after finishing my build. Highly recommend.
Eskiden ingiizce bilen oynasın derdim şimdi Türkçeye çevirmişler(fan yapımı) , yani herkezin oynaması gereken bir oyun tam tadından yenmez olmuş

Despite the many positive comments and reviews, i have to agree with the moderately positive attitude towards the game, like many other (well not that many) reviewers do. I replayed Bioshock 1 and 2 recently, actually the 1st one 2x now, because it is really that awesome. Coming from there to Infinite i had several disappointments. The visuals are indeed awesome (recommend you putting ambient occlusion to medium to get constant 100+ fps while textures etc are in ultra.., which is an excellent feeling) The story is easily a piece of shit, and also not easy to follow. The environment is huge and almost always open-air, but it makes it actually less interesting cause the only difference it will generate is that you walk more. It has almost no cohesion, the mood is really twisted (which is the only good thing). You don´t have the feeling you are actually in that word, can't identify yourself, there are no mentionable characters apart from your company Emily. It´s like you would combat through a dreamworld without having the actual feeling of living it. The combat system is HUGELY simplified, you always never get to use all the weapons and plasmids (vigors here), cause you wont need to, -unless somehow you dont find enough vending machines for ammo so you take what your enemies drop. The enemies are easily the most boring and repetitive elements of the game. At about 2/3 of the game i really wished for the ending, so i can leave the game finally....I could go on and on what i didn´t like about the game, but probably everyone should play it 1x through. (Though it is not even close to Bioshock 1.) I would give a 75% 
(if Bioshock 1 100%, the second around 85%.)

[h1] Pros:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]AMZING story! you will never forget it, and I've never seen any thing like it. Seriously, the writers for this game did a great job.
    [*]The hints given in the game and the obscurity is a nice touch. Every thing that made you say: "WTF is this?" will be explained at the end of the game 
    [*]Elizabeth is a huge asset to the gameplay and the story
    [*]The floating city is just breathtaking.
[/list]

[h1] Cons:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]You have to fight a lot of enemies. I mean A LOT! that you'll get bored towards the end of the game.
    [*]You can't buy most of the upgrades because they are very expensive, you'll purchase probably half of them.
[/list]

I do know, however, this game does stand out against the rest of the other games.  Anyway, this is a great game.  Play it, please.

[h1]Bioshock Infinite Review[/h1]
After Completing this game,
I will say that this game is by far one of my favourite single-player game. Although the Gameplay can be slightly repetitive in a lot of the fight scenes.
The story line is just absolutely incredible by far. It just gave me one of those 'holy shit did that just happen' moments.
With all the different Vigors and different weapons this game really gave you some choosing on what you want to use.
There are a few parts of the game which you get a choice on whether to do one option or another.
I got this game whilst it was on a steam sale. (£4.99) Even at its current price (£19.99) i would still say its worth it.
To be honest i'm still in shock, but this game is a MUST buy!!!
10/10

[h1]Edit from 2020[/h1]: 
After 6 years i decided to replay infinite and all it's DLC's and play Bioshock 1,2 for the first time and i can only recommend this even more. If you haven't played the first two do it. Would you kindly just play this game?

The graphics and audio are amazing and really immerse you into the world.
Great storyline that makes you care about the characters.
I played this game on the PS3 when it came out and got it on steam sale for the dlcs
Combat mechanics are very fun mix of magic and fps shooting and plenty of sidequests for hardcore players.

BioShock Infinte was a very fun game to play. If you enjoy any kind of FPS like battlefield or call of duty give this a try. It is a nice change of pace. Bioshock comes with a really intense story to boot. This game requires you to actually understand whats going on instead of mindlessly shoot at stuff for no reason. The graphics are very good. I noticed a couple of glitchy stuff but not anything that would inhibit your gameplay. There isn't to many choices that you have to make but it is worth playing several times to see the different choices played out. My only real peeve with this game is that I feel like there is to much shooting. This is just a personal opinion not really a flaw in the game. All in all great game definetly worth your time if you like a very involved RPG.

Игра-история, скрытая под оболочкой шутера от первого лица. Красиво, динамично, шокирующе и мило одновременно. Не достаточно длинная, чтобы наскучить, но и не слишком короткая, чтобы вводить в заблуждение. Однозначно стоит своих денег и времени.

This is game amazes me in every way. Every aspect of this game is incredible, its story, the graphics, and the depth of the detail into the characters themselves. Bravo, even though ive played it for 7 hours ill be spending the next week collecting all the trophies :D.

Great game, but there was a consolitis factor to it that I couldn't quite put my finger on. Deep, imersive story that keeps you guessing to the end. The scenery, weapons, and characters are all so bizarre that it ends up being a refreshing experience. Give it a shot if you are looking to expand your shooter horizons.

Ah, Bioshock...
I never really got into the first two installments of the game. Being from the "old school" sci-fi System Shock 2, going backwards never really worked for me, but I could see the appeal.
However, the steampunk-ish look of Infinite was appealing, not to mention colourful (unlike the first two, which were mostly blue and green, which got old fast). And colourful is it ever!

Graphics aside, the game is a rather standard shooter - nothing has been reinvented here. It's very linear, very straightforward; had it held your hand any more than it did, I'd have called it a rail shooter.
But the gameplay is solid and certainly fun.

However, the shooting aspect is not why you play this game. The narrative is what really keeps you going. I can't praise the writing of this game enough. It is convoluted at times, but it makes sense... in an odd, screwed-up sort of way. And hopefully opens the door to many more iterations within this universe.

Long story made short, it's a really awesome game.
However, worth at most 20$ as the game can be rather... short. I spent about 9 hours in the main game and finished the primary campaign... and I'm not sure it warrants a second playthrough for any other reasons than achievement hunting (which I really don't really care much about).
Getting it at 15$ is really a sweet spot for me, but 20$, though higher than I'd really like, is still a very good price.
Get it when it's cheap and you won't regret it!!
Excellent. Probably the best story-driven / on-rails game I've ever played.

Игра просто божественная, уникальная - никогда не выходило и не выйдет ничего подобного. Очень ждал чего-то такого, объединяющего геймплей старых шутеров с эллементами РПГ и отличный сюжет. И вот, наконец-то вышла такая игра. Поначалу я даже и подумать не мог, что такая игра будет принадлежать серии "bioshock". Первая часть была, конечно, хорошей игрой, но после выхода второй части ничего толком не ждал. Infinite воплощает мои представления о идеальной игре. Нельзя также не отметить, что это первый, полноценный стимпанк-шутер, за что игре ещё один огромный плюс. Очень жаль что не будет продолжения (по крайней мере связанного с Коламбией).

Собственно чего и следовало ожидать от создателей легендарного BioShoK. Сюжетная линия грамотно продумана, ну а концовка просто бударажет воображение. Необделили создатели игру и хорошей Графикой (Что конечно же сказалось на системных требованиях, но не очень сильно) ) Геймплей на мой взгляд получился идеальным, отличный баланс и динамика, дают неопесуемые ощущения от игры. В общем всем кто еще в нее не играл советую поиграть. Игра стоит своих денег!
